metadata.title: Pre-Coding Hypothesis Registration
metadata.purpose: Register hypotheses BEFORE visual coding to prevent p-hacking
metadata.modification_policy: NO MODIFICATIONS ALLOWED after visual coding begins

H1.rationale: po is highly enriched in Part 1 (opening words). May mark root-defined entities.

success_criterion.interpretation: STRONG correlation if both criteria met

H1.prediction: Folios with 'po' heading prefix will show distinctive root morphology (e.g., BULBOUS or BRANCHING more frequently than other prefixes)

H2.rationale: ch is the most common body prefix across both Currier A and B. May mark leafy plants.

pilot_coverage.note: ch appears as dominant body prefix in many entries, not just heading

success_criterion.interpretation: STRONG correlation if both criteria met

H2.prediction: Entries with 'ch' as dominant body prefix will show prominent leaf features

H3.rationale: qo shows 2.6x enrichment in biological section. May mark flowering plants.

pilot_coverage.note: Check part dominant prefixes for qo

success_criterion.interpretation: STRONG correlation if both criteria met

H3.prediction: Entries with 'qo' as dominant prefix will show prominent flower features

H4.rationale: ko appears frequently in heading words. 4 folios in pilot have ko heading.
H4.prediction: Folios with 'ko' heading will show similar leaf patterns

pilot_coverage.power_warning: Only 1 folio - insufficient for reliable test

H6.statement: Prefix 'ok' correlates with stem or overall structure
H6.rationale: ok shows zodiac enrichment (1.9x). May mark structured plants.

pilot_coverage.power_warning: Only 1 folio - insufficient for reliable test

S1.statement: Hub entities have simpler illustrations than isolated entries
S1.test_method: Compare overall_complexity scores between HUB and ISOLATED groups
S1.rationale: Foundational entities (frequently referenced) may depict common/simple plants
S1.prediction: HUB entries will have lower complexity scores on average
S1.caveat: Only 2 HUB entries - limited statistical power

S2.statement: Isolated early folios have distinct visual profiles
S2.test_method: Compare visual feature distributions between early isolated and rest
S2.rationale: Early folios never referenced by B - may be introductory or different content
S2.prediction: Early isolated folios may show different root/leaf/flower distributions

S3.statement: Heading prefix predicts overall illustration type
S3.test_method: Cluster folios by visual features, compare to heading prefix groups
S3.rationale: If prefixes encode morphological information, visual clusters should align
S3.prediction: Folios with same heading prefix will cluster together visually

null_predictions.description: Expected results if NO visual-text correlation exists
predictions: Visual features distributed randomly across prefix categories
No significant chi-square results after Bonferroni correction
All correlations below 95th percentile of null model
Hub vs isolated entries have similar complexity distributions
No clustering by heading prefix in visual feature space
null_predictions.implication: If null predictions hold, visual features do not track text prefixes

pre_registration_commitment.analysis_plan: Run all tests specified above with no modifications
pre_registration_commitment.reporting: Report ALL results, including negative findings

success_criteria.overall_success: >=3 correlations at p<0.01 (Bonferroni) AND >=1 at null 99th percentile
success_criteria.failure: <1 significant correlation or all explained by null model

pilot_prefix_coverage.power_assessment: Only po (3) and ko (4) have sufficient representation for reliable prefix-specific tests
